assays: Overexpression in HEK293/COS7 cells (tendency toward decreased protein levels)
DAT binding reduction in striatum (clinical phenotype)

step_1.disease_mechanism: Autosomal recessive EOPD due to DJ1 mutations causing loss of presynaptic dopaminergic afferents.
step_1.variant_association: E64D is associated with EOPD and characterized for functional impact.

step_2.assay_relevance: Crystallography, overexpression, immunocytochemistry, and DAT binding are relevant to assessing structural, expression, localization, and clinical effects.

substep_3a.controls_replicates: Unclear if wild-type/null controls and replicates were explicitly stated. Only heterozygous (brother) vs. homozygous (sister) comparison is mentioned.

substep_3b.accepted_assays: Crystallography, overexpression, immunocytochemistry, and PET-based DAT binding are standard techniques.

substep_4a.statistical_analysis: No quantitative statistical analysis (e.g., p-values, OddsPath) is provided. Results are qualitative.

substep_4b.controls_count: Comparison with heterozygous (brother) and homozygous (sister) is mentioned, but total number of control variants is unspecified. Likely â‰¤10.
